title: Kirchhoff loop - express KLR in 3-resistor circuit

content.question: A circuit is comprised of a battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="open E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math> and three resistors, as shown in the figure. The resistors have resistances <math alttext="R sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="R sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="R sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> and currents <math alttext="I sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="I sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="I sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> in the directions indicated. Which of the following equations represents a correct application of Kirchhoff’s loop rule in the circuit?

choices.label: <math alttext="open E plus I sub 1, end sub, times R sub 1, end sub, plus I sub 2, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="open E minus I sub 1, end sub, times R sub 1, end sub, minus I sub 3, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="open E plus I sub 1, end sub, times R sub 1, end sub, plus I sub 2, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, plus I sub 3, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

<math alttext="open E minus I sub 1, end sub, times R sub 1, end sub, minus I sub 2, end sub, times R sub 2, end sub, minus I sub 3, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open E minus I sub 1, end sub, times R sub 1, end sub, minus I sub 3, end sub, times R sub 3, end sub, equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><msub><mi>R</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>
